intro: Drabopsis nuda, commonly known as the naked drabopsis, is a small, herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant has simple, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and it produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are usually green or pale yellow. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its low-growing habit and drought tolerance. Drabopsis nuda is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
